intro: Dryandra carduacea, commonly known as the narrow-leaved dryandra, is a flowering plant native to Western Australia. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its woody structure and distinctive, often serrated leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish-white flowers that are typically arranged in dense, globular clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to the Mediterranean climate of its native region. Due to its unique appearance and ecological significance, it is often cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
